description: Rada Miskovic, after private deliberation and a heartfelt exchange with a confidant, decides to withhold the Echo Protocol and prepare Halden's confessional video for broadcast, aiming to prompt honest public reflection.

Halden's emotional video confession is aired simultaneously on every city screen. In the message, he discusses BCI's deepest flaws, admits to his own secret struggles, and urges the city to choose empathy over division.
Public assemblies form across Stenograd as residents openly debate the confession. Many express shock at Halden's own BCI struggles, fueling citywide calls for reconciliation.

The Directorate attempts emergency censorship of the confession, but Innovator-aligned officials, supported by Oksana Lintz, counter by leaking more evidence of BCI abuses to reinforce Halden’s message.

Forgiveness ceremonies and public storytelling spread, with citizens—from victims to former enforcers—sharing experiences and gradually rebuilding trust. The Council announces an open forum for the city to determine its own way forward.
